The right slide is stepped like high, med and low. Really wish seller would put full information on there products. Like a PDF or pic of install sheet.

reviews.productTitle: Legrand Pass & Seymour LSCLDC163PWCCV4 450W LS Series Preset Dimmer Light Switch for Dimmable LED and CFL Bulbs Plus 1.6A Fan Control, Single Pole/3-Way, White (1 Count)
reviews.text: The hardest part of the installation was trying to get the switch body to fit in the electrical box. I replaced the fan/light switch in a 41 year old house. This switch comes with wires for 3-way operation. There is no way that another Romex cable would fit in the box I had. In fact I cut the two 3-way switch wires off to get this switch to fit in my single gang box. If you're doing new construction or if you can replace a small box, use the 20 cu in box for this switch. This is the third switch in this location and hopefully the last with its lifetime warranty.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.title: The switch body is HUGE!

reviews.productTitle: Legrand Pass & Seymour LSCLDC163PWCCV4 450W LS Series Preset Dimmer Light Switch for Dimmable LED and CFL Bulbs Plus 1.6A Fan Control, Single Pole/3-Way, White (1 Count)
reviews.text: This device is intended to be in a box that has the hot feed for the circuits. It has one hot for both. That's great if your other three-ways are in a distant box that also has the feeds for the fan/lamp. Unfortunately, my existing three-ways are in the box with the hot on the other side of the room. The box with the feed to the fan/light just has the two travelers from those two three-ways (and the neutrals). Since this device binds both hots you can't separate it out to go to the two devices. If that doesn't make sense - if you had two standard three-way switches, each one would have two travelers and a hot. That's six wires. This combo switch only has five - two sets of travelers and a common hot for both circuits. Fine on one end of the circuit pair, useless on the other.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.title: Be careful where you put this in the circuit

reviews.productTitle: Legrand Pass & Seymour LSCLDC163PWCCV4 450W LS Series Preset Dimmer Light Switch for Dimmable LED and CFL Bulbs Plus 1.6A Fan Control, Single Pole/3-Way, White (1 Count)

reviews.productTitle: Legrand Pass & Seymour LSCLDC163PWCCV4 450W LS Series Preset Dimmer Light Switch for Dimmable LED and CFL Bulbs Plus 1.6A Fan Control, Single Pole/3-Way, White (1 Count)
reviews.text: This is a basic ceiling fan switch that has a dimmer, that works with LED lights, and a 3 position switch for the fan. Nothing too exciting. It just works. Now the best thing about this switch is that you can use it to bypass the remote control that comes with Hunter fans as long as you have a 4-wire electrical wire between the switch and the fan. I imagine the same would work for other fans, like Hampton Bay. Why would I want to bypass the remote? Because I hate is the remote control. But if you like the remote, you don't need to read the rest since the basic single-pole light switch and fan remote will work great for you. I have 4 Hunter fans with LED's in the bedrooms of our home. To keep everything clean (no remote mounted next to the switch) and uniform, I used 4 of these switches. I basically followed the instructions for installing the ceiling fan. But instead of connecting the remote receiver in the fan, I just wired the separate fan and light wires directly to the switch. That's why you need the 4-wire electrical cable between the switch and the fan. The dimmer and 3-position switch works great and no more looking for remotes. Why not 5 stars? I don't know. Because nothing is perfect?
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2022
reviews.title: No Frills Switch - Great Replacement for Hunter Remote Control

reviews.productTitle: Legrand Pass & Seymour LSCLDC163PWCCV4 450W LS Series Preset Dimmer Light Switch for Dimmable LED and CFL Bulbs Plus 1.6A Fan Control, Single Pole/3-Way, White (1 Count)
reviews.text: I have 3 dimmer switches that are exactly like this one and they work perfectly (bought them elsewhere). They're all made by Legrand and I assumed they were the same model as this one, but I don't know for sure now because this one makes the lights flicker like crazy. I'm positive that the LEDs I'm using are dimmable because when I switch them to the other ceiling fans using the other dimmer switches, they work perfectly. Maybe this is a slightly different model and/or maybe their quality control isn't great and I got a lemon.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2022
reviews.title: The lights flicker like crazy

reviews.productTitle: Legrand Pass & Seymour LSCLDC163PWCCV4 450W LS Series Preset Dimmer Light Switch for Dimmable LED and CFL Bulbs Plus 1.6A Fan Control, Single Pole/3-Way, White (1 Count)
reviews.text: Have successfully used these switches for several years. Very good product! Wanted to purchase the small DEC Combo Snap-In light 1/4w. This Pass & Seymour part TM8LMCC LED replaces a plug at the bottom of the switch. It glows green when the light is off. There have been several references within this thread that the contacts miss-form when the LED is inserted causing a non-functioning LED. Can confirm that a new switch already has miss-formed contacts. In any case it appears from numerous searches the LED snap-in light is obsolete and not available for purchase. Please prove me wrong. Thanks for listening.

reviews.title: Excellent Switch - but can't find Snap-In light (Obsolete?)

reviews.text: I use this to control the chandelier in the dining room and the light in the kitchen (it is on the wall between them. My only complaint is that one of the sides was really designed to control a ceiling fan. On that side (the kitchen light, for me), the dimmer is not a smooth sliding dimmer. It has 3 steps of dimming, while the other dimmer is a true slider. I'd like to not have the steps in the one side. Love that fact that you can set your dimmer to your desired level and then just use the toggle to turn it off and on most of the time. Works for my need.

reviews.productTitle: Legrand Pass & Seymour LSCLDC163PWCCV4 450W LS Series Preset Dimmer Light Switch for Dimmable LED and CFL Bulbs Plus 1.6A Fan Control, Single Pole/3-Way, White (1 Count)
reviews.text: This switch works very well, puts all the control into a single slot (good for old homes that only had a single wall switch). I didn't want a remote setup, due to all the drawbacks with remotes. So this switch was perfect. The Light Dimmer (smooth glide) works extremely well with the Dimmable LEDs on my fan. The 'calibration wheel' next to the slider allowed for precise tuning of how I wanted the low to be. Very pleased. The Fan Slider (3 stop points) works decent too. However the lowest notch, may be a bit 'too low' in speed, depending on your fan, weight of its blades, and power it needs to turn at low speed. Mine moves air, but you dont 'feel it' blowing, on the low setting. Electrical Tip: This needs a deep electrical box. I had a standard size 1-gang box, but ended up having to use a 20cu (deepest I could find) box to fit all the wires, wire nuts, and cram it all in and get it fastened. So, keep that in mind.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2020
reviews.title: Good control device... cramped box!

reviews.productTitle: Legrand Pass & Seymour LSCLDC163PWCCV4 450W LS Series Preset Dimmer Light Switch for Dimmable LED and CFL Bulbs Plus 1.6A Fan Control, Single Pole/3-Way, White (1 Count)
reviews.text: There aren’t many options for a single gang led dimmer and fan speed control switch. I replaced an old Leviton one that was not LED rated, due to flickering. Well, this one flickers too, not as often but it does. It also does not dim down very far, even after turning the dimmer adjustment all the way down.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2020
reviews.title: LEDs Flicker

reviews.productTitle: Legrand Pass & Seymour LSCLDC163PWCCV4 450W LS Series Preset Dimmer Light Switch for Dimmable LED and CFL Bulbs Plus 1.6A Fan Control, Single Pole/3-Way, White (1 Count)
reviews.text: We bought one to see if we liked it and ended up buying two more for the other rooms that needed a switch like this. In 7 years in this house we have gone through 5+ of the cheaply made ones from homeDepot and Lowe’s. We are hopeful with only having to flip the switch at the bottom and not actually pull a switch up and down every time it will last much longer. The left side is the light and the right side has three speeds for the fan. This is ONLY for fan & light combos. So glad I found this one! Only wish we had found it sooner. If I needed more than 3 of these I’d have bought more.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2019
reviews.title: Finally found a good quality one! Thank you!

reviews.productTitle: Legrand Pass & Seymour LSCLDC163PWCCV4 450W LS Series Preset Dimmer Light Switch for Dimmable LED and CFL Bulbs Plus 1.6A Fan Control, Single Pole/3-Way, White (1 Count)
reviews.text: I looked at a lot of fan-light dimmer combo switches before deciding on this one. Most of the other ones have a few common design flaws that many reviewers mentioned- the slide buttons were too small, especially for big hands, the buttons were too hard to slide up and down, and/or they broke too easily. Having owned a few of these dimmers I can attest that all of this is true. This one is different. The buttons are pretty big, they slide easily, and they seem sturdier than the other dimmers I've had. Plus this one has a feature not often seen in these combo dimmers- a separate on-off switch for both the fan and light. So if you get your dimmer just where you want it you don't have to set it back to that point every time you power on. Just hit the power switch and it's back to the same level as when you turned it off. I like that. This unit costs a bit more than most of the others, but I figure it's going to last a long time, so for me it's worth it. I'm happy with it.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2019
reviews.title: A Cut Above the Others

reviews.productTitle: Legrand Pass & Seymour LSCLDC163PWCCV4 450W LS Series Preset Dimmer Light Switch for Dimmable LED and CFL Bulbs Plus 1.6A Fan Control, Single Pole/3-Way, White (1 Count)

reviews.productTitle: Legrand Pass & Seymour LSCLDC163PWCCV4 450W LS Series Preset Dimmer Light Switch for Dimmable LED and CFL Bulbs Plus 1.6A Fan Control, Single Pole/3-Way, White (1 Count)
reviews.text: Although it took us nearly a month to finally set aside some time to install this combination dimmer light/fan switch, once we did we were 100% pleased with the results! We did not install this on a fan/light combination but rather two light switches: one that operated an overhead light in a pantry and the second that operated 2 LED HALO downlights in the kitchen ceiling. We wanted the pantry light to be either on or off but we wanted the downlights to be dimmable. So, we installed the 3-speed fan switch to operate the pantry light and the dimmer to operate the downlights and each works - perfectly! The pantry light will dim at each of the 3 speed settings but we simply use the toggle switch to operate the light. The dimmer side definitely dims the downlights but it does not dim them all the way which is actually a great feature. If they were dimmed too far we might not notice they were still on and we would prematurely age the LED lights inadvertently. So, we're pleased at the various levels of light output the dimmer will provide and then being able to turn the downlights on or off at our favorite level is exactly what we were looking for! This is a great product and, yes, a little pricey but when you have two switches in a single box we're just just happy to pay the price for something that works!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2019
reviews.title: Works exactly how we wanted it to work!

reviews.productTitle: Legrand Pass & Seymour LSCLDC163PWCCV4 450W LS Series Preset Dimmer Light Switch for Dimmable LED and CFL Bulbs Plus 1.6A Fan Control, Single Pole/3-Way, White (1 Count)
reviews.text: Too many things can go wrong with electric switches. This is a good manual 3 way switch on or off.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2019
reviews.title: Dimmer works poorly.

reviews.productTitle: Legrand Pass & Seymour LSCLDC163PWCCV4 450W LS Series Preset Dimmer Light Switch for Dimmable LED and CFL Bulbs Plus 1.6A Fan Control, Single Pole/3-Way, White (1 Count)
reviews.text: These units are not true double 3 way switches they must be installed in a third location to interrupt the circuit in order to operate, the original single button three way switches had to remain in place and this unit installed in the middle of the two. So I returned these and purchased the LUTRON wireless receiver three way set and it worked perfectly, I can dim the fan light from either location as well as control the speed of the fan from both locations all without having to install any additional line wires for operation
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2018
reviews.title: Not as advertised

reviews.productTitle: Legrand Pass & Seymour LSCLDC163PWCCV4 450W LS Series Preset Dimmer Light Switch for Dimmable LED and CFL Bulbs Plus 1.6A Fan Control, Single Pole/3-Way, White (1 Count)
reviews.text: Product works as advertised. Nice to have a toggle so you can leave light and/or fan at desired setting. Works well with led lights.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2018
reviews.title: For 3 speed fans and led lights

reviews.productTitle: Legrand Pass & Seymour LSCLDC163PWCCV4 450W LS Series Preset Dimmer Light Switch for Dimmable LED and CFL Bulbs Plus 1.6A Fan Control, Single Pole/3-Way, White (1 Count)
reviews.text: Expensive yet it is the solution I wanted. Bought a new home and there were some dumb switches where you had to push up the slide switches to turn on the fan and the light. With my big hands I was unable to turn the light on without turning on the fan as well. This switch is the solution, simple rocker switches I can now easily turn the light or the fan on or off. Good product and I expect a lifetime of service.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2018
reviews.title: Expensive yet it is the solution I wanted.
